p: In this experiment, all of the measurements are shown as the means ± standard errors (SEs) of at least three biological replicates. Data were evaluated by one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) by using IBM SPSS ® Statistics (Version 19.0, IBM Corporation, New York, NY, USA). Two-tailed Student’s t-test was used to compare the response of two Sphagneticola species under HT treatments. Differences between groups were considered statistically significant if the p value was less than 0.05 ( p < 0.05). OriginPro (Version 8.0, OriginLab Corporation, Northampton, MA, USA) and Adobe Photoshop CC (Version 2014, Adobe Systems, San Jose, CA, USA) software were used for regression analyses and image processing, respectively.
